meanings.definition: A large medal, typically worn as a pendant.
meanings.sent1: She proudly displayed her shiny medallion on a gold chain.
meanings.sent2: The winner of the race received a gleaming medallion as a prize.
meanings.sent3: The medallion swung back and forth like a tiny pendulum.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as the medallion around her neck.
meanings.sent5: The medallion sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A circular or oval decorative object, often used as a design element in architecture or clothing.
meanings.sent1: The intricate medallion was the centerpiece of the ceiling design.
meanings.sent2: She sewed a beautiful medallion onto the collar of her dress.
meanings.sent3: The medallion on the wall seemed to wink at passersby.
meanings.sent4: The medallion of flowers in the garden bloomed brightly in the spring.
meanings.sent5: The medallion pattern on the rug added a touch of elegance to the room.
